Text: Price Reservations in the Nov RTM and the Nov DAM Cc writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List Prices in the November DAM and the November realtime market are correct The NYISO is reserving hoursbeginning and at the PJM proxy bus This notice was posted to the OASIS and the TIE earlier today but has not yet appeared on the TIE so we are posting it again James H Savitt PhD Market Monitor New York Independent System Operator Western Turnpike Altamont NY phone fax email

Difficulties in Posting Price Reservations to the TIE Cc writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List The NYISO has been experiencing difficulties in posting price reservations to the TIE The postings have from time to time been extraordinarily delayed Our internal process identifies such delays in enough time so that we can generate another posting by COB of the appropriate day Several times the originally delayed posting has shown up on the TIE as well resulting in dual postings The NYISO apologizes for any confusion The NYISO notes that the price reservations are also posted to the OASIS and that there have been no problems in tghe latter process James H Savitt PhD Market Monitor New York Independent System Operator Western Turnpike Altamont NY phone fax email

Price Reservations for the July RTM and July DAM Cc writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List The NYISO is reserving hoursbeginning and in the July realtime market to verify prices Prices in the July DayAhead market are correct Pursuant to ECAB the NYISO is reserving the following hours at the following external proxy buses HQ NE OH PJM

Price Reservation for July RealTime Market Cc writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List Upon a subsequent reexamination of the data the NYISO has determined that hourbeginning for the July realtime market was mistakenly not reserved There might have been a metering problem resulting in the passing of some incorrect data Consequently the NYISO is now reserving hourbeginning in the July realtime market to verify the prices in that hour The hour will be corrected or released as soon as possible The NYISO apologizes for the inconvenience but feels that it must reexamine that hour more thoroughly and institute corrections if necessary
